divs: Sighting DetailsWhile standing in the yard I caught a sight I wasn't expecting. I could see a bright white light that appeared to be growing in intensity and size in the sky to the south. It grew to about 2 or 3 times smaller than the moon, in other words this thing was the largest bright object in the sky except for the moon. It was very high, in the neighborhood of 30 thousand feet. Once it grew to what I would call its peek intensity it appeared to begin falling straight down and began to dim. It then began moving due south at a consistent altitude and dimming to about what an aircraft or satellite would resemble including the speed at which it was moving.
trends: There have been 21 other sightings in Little Rock
